Description: Upper body sherd (mended from three fragments) of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora with part of triple-reeded handle; interior reserved; exterior, white slip; roughly excecuted painted decoration; at top of shoulder part of dividing band consisting of vertical bars above two bands; below, to left and right of handle, part of undetermined decoration consisting of large black blob and dots as filling ornament; sides of handle glazed; series of short horizontal on each reed, above two narrow horizontal bands; two tendrils and lotus bud with dots projecting from base of handle; below, glazed with reserved band on which there is an irregular line.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.088)
